articles.title: Kim Jong Il inspects A-A machine gun battery
Kim Jong Il sees winter training of soldiers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il inspects A-A machine gun battery
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Tuesday inspected a women's anti-aircraft machine gun battery under KPA unit No. 991 that had won the three-revolution flag twice.
   After receiving a salute, he looked round the education room, bedroom, kitchen, daily provision store, green house and other facilities of the battery for cultural education and logistics, to take warm care of the life of women soldiers.   
   At the education room, he looked at the photographs the battery soldiers had taken with the President Kim Il Sung. He also inquired after those who had the pictures taken with the President and learned how the education materials including those installed on the desks were used. He urged all the soldiers to become fine women revolutionaries, always remembering that the President visited the battery many a time and showed deep loving care and favors.
   He learned about the details of the soldiers' life -- how they were enjoying entertainment, what the temperature of the bedroom was in winter, what favorite food the women soldiers were taking and how they were cultivating vegetables in the green house.
   He noted with great satisfaction that the women soldiers of the battery were a model in military and political training and managing the economic life neat and clean the way the anti-Japanese heroines had done.   
   He said the soldiers had done a lot of things. He highly praised them for dedicating every moment of their valuable youth to the motherland and the people.
   He called for paying special attention to the life of the women soldiers. He described them as ardent revolutionaries and true patriots who successfully perform their difficult military duties in defence of the motherland, with arms in hand for the party, revolution, motherland and people.
   He then enjoyed an art performance of the soldiers of the battery.
   He gave the women soldiers a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle.
   He had a picture taken with them.
   He was accompanied by generals Hyon Chol Hae and Pak Jae Gyong and other general officers of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Art performance of Korean Art Troupe from Japan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sees winter training of soldiers
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il saw a winter training of soldiers of KPA unit No. 682 on Tuesday.
   Present on the occasion were generals Hyon Chol Hae and Pak Jae Gyong and other general officers of the Korean People's Army.
   After seeing the training filled with invincible spirit, he expressed great satisfaction and highly praised all the servicemen of the unit from the officers to the men as well as their families for having grown to be invincible fighters prepared politically, ideologically and physically and in military technique.   
   He said the People's Army's spirit of devoted defence of the leader, ardent patriotism and self-sacrificing spirit constitute a great factor for defeating any formidable enemy in the world at one stroke. The motherland is an impregnable fortress as it has invincible revolutionary armed forces with the People's Army at the core, he added.
   He said the guns of the revolution are a guarantee for national prosperity and victory in socialism. He advanced important tasks to further strengthen the revolutionary armed forces.   
   He gave the unit a pair of binoculars, a machine gun and an automatic rifle as gifts. He met with model soldiers, appreciated their successful training and had a picture taken with them.
   He also met with wives and children of the unit's officers involved in the winter training, appreciated their deeds, warmly encouraged them and had a picture taken with them.

articles.title: Floral basket laid before Kim Il Sung's Statue
articles.content:
Art performance of Korean Art Troupe from Japan
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan gave a performance "the Marshal is theï¿½@destiny of Chongryon and the father of 700,000 Koreans in Japan" for guests of honor here on Tuesday on the occasion of the February holiday.   Appreciating the performance were Hong Song Nam, premier of the cabinet, officials concerned, working people, artistes, youth and students in Pyongyang.   Put on the stage were a song and dance "We make a big bow of wish" which represents  wishes for longevity of General Secretary Kim Jong Il,  a male trio "He gives only love" a Jangsaenap solo and Pangchang "Our pride is boundless" and other colorful pieces.   The performers vividly showed the pride and happiness of the officials of Chongryon (General Association of Korean Residents In Japan) and Koreans in Japan who are exalting the dignity and honor of being overseas citizens of Juche Korea.

articles.title: Congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il from O Ik Je
articles.content:
Floral basket laid before Kim Il Sung's Statue
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Members of the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea laid a floral basket before the Statue of the  President Kim Il Sung on Mansu hill in Pyongyang on Feb. 16, the lunar New Year's day, and paid tribute to him.   That day, they visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong to lay bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, the great communist revolutionary fighter and anti-Japanese heroine, and observed a moment's silence in her memory.

articles.title: Congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il from Ri In Mo
articles.content:
Congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il from O Ik Je
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter from O Ik Je, vice-chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, on Feb. 16, his birthday.      The letter says:   Your birth on Mt. Paektu was an event worthy of special mention in the history of the Tangun nation and humankind.   You grew up cultivating the spirit of Mt. Paektu and grasping the same resourcefulness and grit as Mt. Paektu.    The door to building a powerful nation has been opened wide on this land. This is a result of the tireless efforts made by you while leading this country in the spirit of Mt. Paektu.   The country and nation are one as there is Mt. Paektu rising high with your will for independence. You will reunify the country in the spirit of Mt. Paektu.   As long as we are led by you, our country will be as dignified and proud as Mt. Paektu. O Ik Je wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Il a long life in good health.

articles.title: Evening gala of Pyongyang youth and students
articles.content:
Congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il from Ri In Mo 
     Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter from Ri In Mo, the incarnation of faith and will, on Feb. 16, his birthday.      He said:   Spending 6 years under the benevolent care of the party, I have keenly felt that you, the respected Marshal, are the greatest man endowed with literary and military accomplishments, loyalty and filial piety,  who is highly respected and praised by all people.    You have single-handedly defended Korean socialism and the destiny of the entire nation by subduing and dispiriting formidable enemies, looking down on them.   You are a peerless patriot and a great revolutionary who always wins victory after victory by making tireless efforts for the country and the people.   My family and I will remain loyal and devoted to you, bearing your greatness deep in mind.   Ri In Mo wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Il a long life in good health.

articles.title: Central meeting of Koreans in Japan held to celebrate Kim Jong Il's birthday
articles.content:
Evening gala of Pyongyang youth and students
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- An evening gala of youth and students in Pyongyang took place at the Central Youth Hall on the evening of Tuesday to celebrate the 57th birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.   Present on the occasion were Yang Hyong Sop, Kim Jung Rin and other senior party and state officials.   Overseas Koreans on a visit to the socialist homeland were also on hand.   At the evening gala speeches were made by People's Army soldiers and other young people who had the honor of having met Kim Jong Il.   The participants enjoyed the holiday evening, dancing full of youthful stamina and vigor with the firm determination to live up to the trust and expectation of Kim Jong Il who is putting them forward as shock-brigades for the building of a powerful nation.

articles.title: Hong Song Nam meets leading members of Korean Art Troupe in Japan
Reception for overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Hong Song Nam meets leading members of Korean Art Troupe in Japan
    Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Premier of the cabinet Hong Song Nam on Tuesday met and conversed with leading members and major actors and actresses of the Korean Art Troupe in Japan led by Kim Hong Chol, head of the Kumgangsan Opera Troupe under Chongryon (General Association of Korean Residents In Japan) which has come here to celebrate February 16.

articles.title: Gifts, floral basket and congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il
Camping begins at Jangjasan children's camp
articles.content:
Gifts, floral basket and congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift and a congratulatory letter from Claudio Campos, secretary general of the October 8 Revolutionary Movement of Brazil, a floral basket and a gift from the Communist Party of Ireland (Marxism-Leninism), a gift from the Funcinpec Party of Cambodia, a gift from a delegation of the Unified Communist Party of Italy and a gift from the director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and his party on the occasion of his birthday.   The gifts, congratulatory letter and floral basket were handed to officials concerned.

articles.title: Congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan visits 3rd Kimjongilia show
articles.content:
Camping begins at Jangjasan children's camp
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The first camping started at the Jangjasan children's camp this year on the occasion of the auspicious February holiday.   The camp is located in Jagang Province.    School children across the country will spend joyful days at the camp.   A ceremony for starting the camping took place on Feb. 16.

articles.title: Art performances given to celebrate Kim Jong Il's birthday
articles.content:
Congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan visits 3rd Kimjongilia show
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Korean residents in Japan led by So Man Sul, first vice-chairman of the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents In Japan, on a visit to socialist homeland, visited the 3rd Kimjongilia show on Feb. 16, the 57th birthday of General Secretary  Kim Jong Il.   Members of the group saw with deep emotion Kimjongilia in full bloom presented by many units and people of various social standings across the country and foreigners.   On the same day, foreign party delegations and delegates on a visit to Korea visited the show.

articles.title: Foreign party delegations arrive
articles.content:
Art performances given to celebrate Kim Jong Il's birthday
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Art performances were given at theatres here on Tuesday to celebrate the 57th birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   Seeing the performances were Kim Yong Nam, Ri Jong Ok, Pak Song Chol, Jo Myong Rok and other senior party and state officials.
   Overseas compatriots including So Man Sul, first vice-chairman of the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, were also present.
   Invited to them were foreign delegations and guests on a visit to Korea and foreign diplomatic envoys and embassy officials to Korea.   
   The numbers included a chorus of the revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Jong Il," a female sextet and chorus "Our general is best" and an orchestra "Thunder on Jong Il Peak."
   Performers represented well the great honor and joy of the Korean people and the world's revolutionary people in splendidly celebrating February 16 as the greatest national holiday and a great event common to humankind. They also demonstrated the steadfast faith and indomitable will of the Korean people to build a powerful socialist nation of Juche on this land without fail.

articles.title: Banquet given to mark February holiday
articles.content:
Foreign party delegations arrive
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia led by chairperson Sazhi Umalatova, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, and a delegation of the Arab Socialist Baath Party of Syria headed by Ahmad Kabalan, member of the Regional Leadership and director of the Peasants Department of the Party,  arrived here on Tuesday to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.   They were met at the airport by secretary Kim Ki Nam of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea.

articles.title: Condolences to widow of Ariji secretary general
Secretary Kim Jung Rin meets Brazilian guest
articles.content:
Condolences to widow of Ariji secretary general 
   Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday sent a message of condolence to the widow of secretary general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea (Ariji) Govind Narain Srivastava upon his unexpected death from illness.   The message said the late Srivastava was a prominent social activist who had grown to be an ardent adherent of the Juche idea under the loving care of the great leaders President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Il and devotedly worked for independence of India and the world. He was also a close friend of the Korean people and the Juche idea followers of the world, it added.   His death is, indeed, a big loss for all the adherents of the Juche idea working hard to realize humankind's cause of independence, the message said.   It went on:   Though he passed away, his feats for global independence will remain long in the hearts of the Korean people and the world's progressives.
